configuration.name: appConfig
configuration.label: Configuration
configuration.value:
This endpoint permits to connect your SLINGR app with your Slack team to exchange information and interact with the users through Slack channels, Slash commands and Slack buttons (interactive messages). Configure the Slack app as follow:
  • Access to the New app page
  • Select an app name and a team. Push 'Create App' button.
  • Bot Users: push 'Add a Bot User', select a bot username and save.
  • Slash Commands: If you want to use slash commands, you need to create them using the 'Slash commands URL' from this form as 'Request URL'. Copy the Verification Token from 'Basic Information' (App Credentials -> Verification Token) to this form.
  • Interactive Messages: Enable interactive messages and copy the 'Interactive message URL' from this form to as 'Request URL'
  • Check scopes: got to 'OAuth & Permissions'. Check that the following permisions are selected on 'Permission Scopes' section:
    • bot
    • commands (optional if there are slash commands defined)
    • chat:write:user (optional if you want to post message in name of the users)
  • Install app to your team: click 'Install app to team' button and authorize:
    • Copy OAuth Access Token to 'User API token' on this form
    • Copy User OAuth Access Token to 'Bot API token' on this form
  • Events Subscriptions: Before to enable the service, the endpoint must be deployed because Slack will check its availability. With this endpoint running, enable the events on the Slack app configuration page and copy the 'Events URL' on this form to the 'Request URL'. After that the URL should be verified by Slack. Subscribe to the team and bot events that you want and reinstall the application on the 'Install App' page to accept the new selected permissions.
Documentation: Building Slack apps and Building internal integrations for your team
